body.p: In the Board’s view, it is not clear whether the definitions overlap (because the definitions are not mutually exclusive) or whether it is merely difficult to distinguish the effects of a plan amendment, curtailment and settlement when they occur together. However, entities would need to distinguish these items if entities were required to include the amount relating to each in a different component of defined benefit cost.
